data:
In the Holy Quran, Allah Almighty says,

فَقُلْتُ اسْتَغْفِرُوْا رَبَّكُمْ ؕ اِنَّهٗ كَانَ غَفَّارًاۙ۝۱۰ یُّرْسِلِ السَّمَآءَ عَلَیْكُمْ مِّدْرَارًاۙ۝۱۱ وَّ یُمْدِدْكُمْ بِاَمْوَالٍ وَّ بَنِیْنَ وَ یَجْعَلْ لَّكُمْ جَنّٰتٍ وَّ یَجْعَلْ لَّكُمْ اَنْهٰرًاؕ۝۱۲ مَا لَكُمْ لَا تَرْجُوْنَ لِلّٰهِ وَقَارًاۚ۝۱۳

I said: Seek forgiveness from your Lord. Indeed, He is Ever-Forgiving. He will send down rain upon you in abundance, grant you increase in wealth and children, and provide you with gardens and rivers. What is wrong with you that you do not fear the greatness of Allah?

Surah Nuh, Ayat 10-13 Source: Tafseer-e-Tawzeehul Quran

Narrated by Abu Hurayra (RA), the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said,

الصِّيَامُ جُنَّةٌ فَلاَ يَرْفُثْ ، وَلاَ يَجْهَلْ وَإِنِ امْرُؤٌ قَاتَلَهُ ، أَوْ شَاتَمَهُ فَلْيَقُلْ إِنِّي صَائِمٌ مَرَّتَيْنِ وَالَّذِي نَفْسِي بِيَدِهِ لَخُلُوفُ فَمِ الصَّائِمِ أَطْيَبُ عِنْدَ اللهِ تَعَالَى مِنْ رِيحِ الْمِسْكِ يَتْرُكُ طَعَامَهُ وَشَرَابَهُ وَشَهْوَتَهُ مِنْ أَجْلِي الصِّيَامُ لِي وَأَنَا أَجْزِي بِهِ وَالْحَسَنَةُ بِعَشْرِ أَمْثَالِهَا

Fasting is a shield. Therefore, do not engage in obscene talk or foolish behavior. If someone tries to fight or insult him, let him say twice, 'I am fasting.' By the One in whose hand is my soul, the smell of a fasting person's mouth is more pleasant to Allah than the fragrance of musk. He abandons his food, drink, and desires for My sake. Fasting is for Me, and I will reward it. Every good deed is rewarded tenfold.

Sahih Bukhari, Hadith 1894 (Fuad Abdul Baqi edition), 1783 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

In the Holy Quran, Allah Almighty says,

یٰبُنَیَّ اَقِمِ الصَّلٰوةَ وَ اْمُرْ بِالْمَعْرُوْفِ وَ انْهَ عَنِ الْمُنْكَرِ وَ اصْبِرْ عَلٰی مَاۤ اَصَابَكَ ؕ اِنَّ ذٰلِكَ مِنْ عَزْمِ الْاُمُوْرِۚ

(Luqman [AS] said to his son) O my son! Establish prayer, enjoin what is right, forbid what is wrong, and be patient with whatever befalls you. Indeed, this is a matter of great resolve.

Surah Luqman, Ayat 17 Source: Tafseer-e-Tawzeehul Quran

Footnote:

Establishing prayer means performing it with all its conditions, on time, and with the congregation.

In the Holy Quran, Allah Almighty says,

اِنَّ الْمُسْلِمِیْنَ وَ الْمُسْلِمٰتِ وَ الْمُؤْمِنِیْنَ وَ الْمُؤْمِنٰتِ وَ الْقٰنِتِیْنَ وَ الْقٰنِت تٰتِ وَ الصّٰدِقِیْنَ وَ الصّٰدِقٰتِ وَ الصّٰبِرِیْنَ وَ الصّٰبِرٰتِ وَ الْخٰشِعِیْنَ وَ الْخٰشِعٰتِ وَ الْمُتَصَدِّقِیْنَ وَ الْمُتَصَدِّقٰتِ وَ الصَّآىِٕمِیْنَ وَ الصّٰٓىِٕمٰتِ وَ الْحٰفِظِیْنَ فُرُوْجَهُمْ وَ الْحٰفِظٰتِ وَ الذّٰكِرِیْنَ اللّٰهَ كَثِیْرًا وَّ الذّٰكِرٰتِ ۙ اَعَدَّ اللّٰهُ لَهُمْ مَّغْفِرَةً وَّ اَجْرًا عَظِیْمًا

Indeed, the Muslim men and Muslim women, the believing men and believing women, the obedient men and obedient women, the truthful men and truthful women, the patient men and patient women, the humble men and humble women, the charitable men and charitable women, the fasting men and fasting women, the men who guard their chastity and the women who guard their chastity, and the men who remember Allah frequently and the women who remember Allah frequently—Allah has prepared for them forgiveness and a great reward.

Surah Al-Ahzab, Ayat 35 Source: Tafseer-e-Tawzeehul Quran

Narrated by Usman ibn Affan (RA), the Prophet (peace be upon him) said,

مَنْ قَالَ بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الَّذِى لاَ يَضُرُّ مَعَ اسْمِهِ شَىْءٌ فِى الأَرْضِ وَلاَ فِى السَّمَاءِ وَهُوَ السَّمِيعُ الْعَلِيمُ ثَلاَثَ مَرَّاتٍ لَمْ تُصِبْهُ فَجْأَةُ بَلاَءٍ حَتَّى يُصْبِحَ وَمَنْ قَالَهَا حِينَ يُصْبِحُ ثَلاَثَ مَرَّاتٍ لَمْ تُصِبْهُ فَجْأَةُ بَلاَءٍ حَتَّى يُمْسِىَ

Whoever recites this supplication three times in the morning will be protected from sudden calamities until evening, and whoever recites it in the evening will be protected until morning. بِسْمِ اللهِ الَّذِىْ لَا يَضُرُّ مَعَ اسْمِهٖ شَىْءٌ فِى الْاَرْضِ وَلَا فِى السَّمَاءِ وَهُوَ السَّمِيْعُ الْعَلِيْمُ (Meaning: I begin in the name of Allah, with whose name nothing in the heavens or on earth can cause harm, and He is the All-Hearing, the All-Knowing.) One of the narrators of this hadith was paralyzed. When someone looked at him in astonishment, he said: By Allah, I am not lying. The day I was afflicted with this calamity, I forgot to recite this supplication.

Sunan Abu Dawood, Hadith 5088

Narrated by Sumama ibn Abdullah (RA), he said,

كَانَ أَنَسٌ يَتَنَفَّسُ فِي الإِنَاءِ مَرَّتَيْنِ ، أَوْ ثَلاَثًا وَزَعَمَ أَنَّ النَّبِيَّ صلى الله عليه وسلم كَانَ يَتَنَفَّسُ ثَلاَثًا

It was the practice of Anas (RA) to drink water in two or three breaths. He believed that the Prophet (peace be upon him) used to drink in three breaths.

Sahih Bukhari, Hadith 5229 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh) 5631 (Fuad Abdul Baqi edition)

Narrated by Abu Hurayra (RA), he heard the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) say,

أَرَأَيْتُمْ لَوْ أَن’ نَهَرًا بِبَابِ أَحَدِكُمْ يَغْتَسِلُ فِيهِ كُلَّ يَوْمٍ خَمْسًا مَا تَقُولُ ذَلِكَ يُبْقِي مِنْ دَرَنِهِ ؟ قَالُوا : لاَ يُبْقِي مِنْ دَرَنِهِ شَيْئًا قَالَ فَذَلِكَ مِثْلُ الصَّلَوَاتِ الْخَمْسِ يَمْحُو اللَّهُ بِهَا الْخَطَايَا.

Tell me, if there were a river at the door of one of you and he bathed in it five times a day, would any dirt remain on him? They said, No dirt would remain on him. The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: That is the example of the five daily prayers; through them, Allah wipes away sins.

Sahih Bukhari, 528 (Fuad Abdul Baqi edition), 503 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

In the Holy Quran, Allah Almighty says,

یٰۤاَیُّهَا الَّذِیْنَ اٰمَنُوْا قُوْۤا اَنْفُسَكُمْ وَ اَهْلِیْكُمْ نَارًا وَّ قُوْدُهَا النَّاسُ وَ الْحِجَارَةُ عَلَیْهَا مَلٰٓىِٕكَةٌ غِلَاظٌ شِدَادٌ لَّا یَعْصُوْنَ اللّٰهَ مَاۤ اَمَرَهُمْ وَ یَفْعَلُوْنَ مَا یُؤْمَرُوْنَ

O you who believe! Protect yourselves and your families from a Fire whose fuel is people and stones, over which are appointed angels, stern and severe, who do not disobey Allah in what He commands them and do what they are commanded.

Surah At-Tahrim, Ayat 6

Narrated by Abu Hurayra (RA), the Prophet (peace be upon him) said,

مَنْ لَمْ يَدَعْ قَوْلَ الزُّورِ وَالْعَمَلَ بِهِ فَلَيْسَ لِلَّهِ حَاجَةٌ فِي أَنْ يَدَعَ طَعَامَهُ وَشَرَابَهُ

Whoever does not abandon false speech and acting upon it, Allah has no need for him to abandon his food and drink (in the name of fasting).

Sahih Bukhari, Hadith 1903 (Fuad Abdul Baqi edition), 5631 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by Abdullah ibn Umar (RA), the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said,

صَلاَةُ الْجَمَاعَةِ تَفْضُلُ صَلاَةَ الْفَذِّ بِسَبْعٍ وَعِشْرِينَ دَرَجَةً

The reward of prayer in congregation is twenty-seven times greater than the prayer performed individually.

Sahih Bukhari, Hadith 645 (Fuad Abdul Baqi edition), 617 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Footnote:

This reward applies to men. For women, praying at home is better, as stated in authentic hadith.

In the Holy Quran, Allah Almighty says,

فَبِظُلْمٍ مِّنَ الَّذِیْنَ هَادُوْا حَرَّمْنَا عَلَیْهِمْ طَیِّبٰتٍ اُحِلَّتْ لَهُمْ وَ بِصَدِّهِمْ عَنْ سَبِیْلِ اللّٰهِ كَثِیْرًاۙ۝۱۶۰ وَّ اَخْذِهِمُ الرِّبٰوا وَ قَدْ نُهُوْا عَنْهُ وَ اَكْلِهِمْ اَمْوَالَ النَّاسِ بِالْبَاطِلِ ؕ وَ اَعْتَدْنَا لِلْكٰفِرِیْنَ مِنْهُمْ عَذَابًا اَلِیْمًا۝۱۶۱

Due to the wrongdoing of the Jews, We made unlawful for them certain good things that were lawful for them, and because of their hindering many from the way of Allah, and their taking of usury though they were forbidden from it, and their devouring of people's wealth unjustly. And We have prepared for the disbelievers among them a painful punishment.

Surah An-Nisa, Ayat 160, 161 Source: Tafseer-e-Tawzeehul Quran

Footnote:

The Jews committed grave transgressions in following their religion. They also obstructed others from the path of Allah, engaged in usury, and unjustly consumed people's wealth. As a result, certain good things were made unlawful for them as punishment. Notably, these acts are also considered sinful and forbidden in our Shariah. We must avoid such acts to escape severe punishment in the Hereafter.

Narrated by Miqdam ibn Ma’dikarib (RA), he heard the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) say,

مَا مَلأَ آدَمِيٌّ وِعَاءً شَرًّا مِنْ بَطْنٍ. بِحَسْبِ ابْنِ آدَمَ أُكُلاَتٌ يُقِمْنَ صُلْبَهُ ، فَإِنْ كَانَ لاَ مَحَالَةَ فَثُلُثٌ لِطَعَامِهِ وَثُلُثٌ لِشَرَابِهِ وَثُلُثٌ لِنَفَسِهِ

Man fills no vessel worse than his stomach. A few morsels that keep his back straight are sufficient for the son of Adam. If he must eat more, then one-third for food, one-third for drink, and one-third for his breath.

Jami’ At-Tirmidhi, Hadith 2380 (Ahmad Shakir edition), 2383 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by Abu Musa Ash’ari (RA), the Prophet (peace be upon him) said,

أَيُّمَا رَجُلٍ كَانَتْ لَهُ جَارِيَةٌ فَأَدَّبَهَا فَأَحْسَنَ تَأْدِيبَهَا وَأَعْتَقَهَا وَتَزَوَّجَهَا فَلَهُ أَجْرَانِ وَأَيُّمَا عَبْدٍ أَدَّى حَقَّ اللهِ وَحَقَّ مَوَالِيهِ فَلَهُ أَجْرَانِ.

Whoever educates his female slave well, frees her, and marries her will receive a double reward. And any slave who fulfills his duty to Allah and his master will also receive a double reward.

Sahih Bukhari, Hadith 2547 (Fuad Abdul Baqi edition), 2379 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

In the Holy Quran, Allah Almighty says,

یٰۤاَیُّهَا الْمُدَّثِّرُۙ۝۱ قُمْ فَاَنْذِرْ۪ۙ۝۲ وَ رَبَّكَ فَكَبِّرْ۪ۙ۝۳ وَ ثِیَابَكَ فَطَهِّرْ۪ۙ۝۴ وَ الرُّجْزَ فَاهْجُرْ۪ۙ۝۵ وَ لَا تَمْنُنْ تَسْتَكْثِرُ۪ۙ۝۶ وَ لِرَبِّكَ فَاصْبِرْؕ۝۷

O you who are cloaked! Arise and warn. And proclaim the greatness of your Lord. And keep your garments pure. And avoid impurity. And do not confer favors expecting more in return. And for your Lord, be patient.

Surah Al-Muddaththir, Ayat 1-7 Source: Tafseer-e-Tawzeehul Quran

Footnote:

Giving gifts with the expectation of receiving more in return is impermissible according to this verse.

Narrated by Abu Hurayra (RA), he said,

جَاءَ رَجُلٌ إِلَى رَسُولِ اللهِ صلى الله عليه وسلم فَقَالَ يَا رَسُولَ اللهِ مَنْ أَحَقُّ بِحُسْنِ صَحَابَتِي قَالَ أُمُّكَ قَالَ ثُمَّ مَنْ قَالَ أُمُّكَ قَالَ ثُمَّ مَنْ قَالَ أُمُّكَ قَالَ ثُمَّ مَنْ قَالَ ثُمَّ أَبُوكَ

A man came to the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) and asked: O Messenger of Allah! Who is most deserving of my good companionship? He replied: Your mother. The man asked: Then who? He replied: Your mother. The man asked: Then who? He replied: Your mother. The man asked: Then who? He replied: Then your father.

Sahih Bukhari, Hadith 5971 (Fuad Abdul Baqi edition), 5546 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by Abu Sa’id Al-Khudri (RA), he heard the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) say,

مَنْ رَأَى مُنْكَرًا فَاسْتَطَاعَ أَنْ يُغَيِّرَهُ بِيَدِهِ فَلْيُغَيِّرْهُ بِيَدِهِ فَإِنْ لَمْ يَسْتَطِعْ فَبِلِسَانِهِ فَإِنْ لَمْ يَسْتَطِعْ فَبِقَلْبِهِ وَذَلِكَ أَضْعَفُ الإِيمَانِ

Whoever sees an evil and is able to stop it with his hand should do so. If he cannot, then with his tongue. If he cannot, then with his heart, and that is the weakest form of faith.

Sunan Abu Dawood, Hadith 1140 Islamic Foundation Bangladesh

Narrated by Abu Hurayra (RA), he said,

جَاءَ رَجُلٌ إِلَى النَّبِىِّ -صلى الله عليه وسلم- فَقَالَ يَا رَسُولَ اللَّهِ مَا لَقِيتُ مِنْ عَقْرَبٍ لَدَغَتْنِى الْبَارِحَةَ قَالَ « أَمَا لَوْ قُلْتَ حِينَ أَمْسَيْتَ أَعُوذُ بِكَلِمَاتِ اللَّهِ التَّامَّاتِ مِنْ شَرِّ مَا خَلَقَ لَمْ تَضُرُّكَ »

A companion said to the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him): Last night, I was stung by a scorpion the likes of which I have never seen. The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: If you had recited this supplication in the evening, it would not have harmed you— اَعُوْذُ بِكَلِمَاتِ اللهِ التَّآمَّاتِ مِنْ شَرِّ مَا خَلَقَ (Meaning: I seek refuge in the perfect words of Allah from the evil of what He has created.) This supplication can also be recited in the morning.

Sahih Muslim, Hadith 2709 (Fuad Abdul Baqi edition), 6633 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by Abu Hurayra (RA), the Prophet (peace be upon him) said,

مَا أَسْفَلَ مِنَ الْكَعْبَيْنِ مِنَ الإِزَارِ فَفِي النَّار

Whatever part of the izaar (lower garment) hangs below the ankles is in the Fire.

Sahih Bukhari, Hadith 5787 (Fuad Abdul Baqi edition), 5371 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Footnote:

Izaar refers to a lungi, but this prohibition applies to all types of clothing, such as lungis, pants, pajamas, or jubbas, which should not hang below the ankles.

Narrated by Abu Hurayra (RA), the Noble Prophet (peace be upon him) said,

مَنْ أَخَذَ أَمْوَالَ النَّاسِ يُرِيدُ أَدَاءَهَا أَدَّى اللَّهُ عَنْهُ ، وَمَنْ أَخَذَ يُرِيدُ إِتْلاَفَهَا أَتْلَفَهُ اللَّهُ

Whoever takes people’s wealth with the intention of repaying it, Allah will facilitate its repayment. But whoever takes it with the intention of destroying it, Allah will destroy him.

Sahih Bukhari, Hadith 2387 (Fuad Abdul Baqi edition), 2229 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by Abu Hurayra (RA), the Prophet (peace be upon him) said,

الإِيمَانُ بِضْعٌ وَسِتُّونَ شُعْبَةً وَالْحَيَاءُ شُعْبَةٌ مِنَ الإِيمَانِ

Faith has over sixty branches, and modesty is one of them.

Sahih Bukhari, Hadith 9 (Fuad Abdul Baqi edition), 8 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

In the Holy Quran, Allah Almighty says,

وَ اَنْكِحُوا الْاَیَامٰی مِنْكُمْ وَ الصّٰلِحِیْنَ مِنْ عِبَادِكُمْ وَ اِمَآىِٕكُمْ ؕ اِنْ یَّكُوْنُوْا فُقَرَآءَ یُغْنِهِمُ اللّٰهُ مِنْ فَضْلِهٖ ؕ وَ اللّٰهُ وَاسِعٌ عَلِیْمٌ۝۳۲

Arrange marriages for the unmarried among you, whether male or female, and for the righteous among your male and female slaves. If they are poor, Allah will enrich them out of His bounty. Allah is All-Encompassing, All-Knowing.

Surah An-Nur, Ayat 32 Source: Tafseer-e-Tawzeehul Quran

Narrated by Amr ibn Al-As (RA), he heard the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) say,

إِذَا حَكَمَ الْحَاكِمُ فَاجْتَهَدَ ثمَّ أَصَابَ فَلَهُ أَجْرَانِ ، وَإِذَا حَكَمَ فَاجْتَهَدَ ثُمَّ أَخْطَأَ فَلَهُ أَجْرٌ

If a judge makes a ruling with ijtihad (independent reasoning) and is correct, he will receive two rewards. If he makes a ruling with ijtihad and is mistaken, he will receive one reward.

Sahih Bukhari, Hadith 6850 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh) 7352 (Fuad Abdul Baqi edition)

Footnote:

This ijtihad may apply to issuing religious rulings or judicial decisions in accordance with Islamic law. However, the person performing ijtihad must be qualified and competent to do so.

In the Holy Quran, Allah Almighty says,

یٰۤاَیُّهَا الَّذِیْنَ اٰمَنُوْا لَا یَحِلُّ لَكُمْ اَنْ تَرِثُوا النِّسَآءَ كَرْهًا ؕ وَ لَا تَعْضُلُوْهُنَّ لِتَذْهَبُوْا بِبَعْضِ مَاۤ اٰتَیْتُمُوْهُنَّ اِلَّاۤ اَنْ یَّاْتِیْنَ بِفَاحِشَةٍ مُّبَیِّنَةٍ ۚ وَ عَاشِرُوْهُنَّ بِالْمَعْرُوْفِ ۚ فَاِنْ كَرِهْتُمُوْهُنَّ فَعَسٰۤی اَنْ تَكْرَهُوْا شَیْـًٔا وَّ یَجْعَلَ اللّٰهُ فِیْهِ خَیْرًا كَثِیْرًا۝

O you who believe! It is not lawful for you to inherit women by force. Nor should you detain them to take back part of what you have given them, unless they commit clear immorality. Live with them in kindness. If you dislike them, it may be that you dislike something in which Allah has placed much good.

Surah An-Nisa, Ayat 19 Source: Tafseer-e-Tawzeehul Quran

Footnote:

In the pre-Islamic era, it was customary for an heir to claim ownership of a deceased man's wife as part of his inheritance. He might marry her without a dowry or marry her off to someone else to claim the dowry. This verse prohibits such practices, declaring that a woman becomes free upon her husband’s death, subject to the rules of Shariah.

Narrated by Jabir ibn Abdullah (RA), the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said,

رَحِمَ اللَّهُ رَجُلاً سَمْحًا إِذَا بَاعَ ، وَإِذَا اشْتَرَى ، وَإِذَا اقْتَضَى

May Allah have mercy on a person who is lenient when he sells, buys, or demands repayment.

Sahih Bukhari, Hadith 2076 (Fuad Abdul Baqi edition), 1946 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by Abu Hurayra (RA), the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said,

بَيْنَمَا رَجُلٌ يَمْشِي بِطَرِيقٍ وَجَدَ غُصْنَ شَوْكٍ فَأَخَذَهُ فَشَكَرَ اللَّهُ لَهُ فَغَفَرَ لَهُ.

A man walking along a path found a thorny branch and removed it. Allah appreciated his action and forgave him.

Sahih Bukhari, Hadith 2472 (Fuad Abdul Baqi edition), 2310 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by Abu Hurayra (RA), the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said,

مَنْ تَصَدَّقَ بِعَدْلِ تَمْرَةٍ مِنْ كَسْبٍ طَيِّبٍ ، وَلاَ يَقْبَلُ اللَّهُ إِلاَّ الطَّيِّبَ - وَإِنَّ اللَّهَ يَتَقَبَّلُهَا بِيَمِينِهِ ثُمَّ يُرَبِّيهَا لِصَاحِبِهِ كَمَا يُرَبِّي أَحَدُكُمْ فَلْوَهُ حَتَّى تَكُونَ مِثْلَ الْجَبَلِ.

Whoever gives charity equivalent to a single date from lawful earnings—and Allah accepts only that which is pure—Allah accepts it with His right hand and nurtures it for its giver as one of you nurtures a foal until it becomes like a mountain.

Sahih Bukhari, Hadith 1410 (Fuad Abdul Baqi edition), 1327 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by Abu Hurayra (RA), the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said,

كَفَى بِالْمَرْءِ كَذِبًا أَنْ يُحَدِّثَ بِكُلِّ مَا سَمِعَ

It is enough for a man to be considered a liar if he narrates everything he hears.

Sahih Muslim, Hadith 5 (Fuad Abdul Baqi edition), Introduction Section (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by Abu Mas’ud Al-Badri (RA), the Prophet (peace be upon him) said,

إِنَّ الْمُسْلِمَ إِذَا أَنْفَقَ عَلَى أَهْلِهِ نَفَقَةً وَهُوَ يَحْتَسِبُهَا كَانَتْ لَهُ صَدَقَةً

If a Muslim spends on his family seeking reward, it will be considered charity for him.

Sahih Muslim, Hadith 1002 (Fuad Abdul Baqi edition), 2191 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by Aisha (RA),

سُئِلَ النَّبِيُّ صلى الله عليه وسلم أَيُّ الأَعْمَالِ أَحَبُّ إِلَى اللهِ قَالَ أَدْوَمُهَا وَإِنْ قَلَّ وَقَالَ اكْلَفُوا مِنَ الأَعْمَالِ مَا تُطِيقُون.

The Prophet (peace be upon him) was asked: Which deed is most beloved to Allah? He replied: The one that is most consistent, even if it is small. He also said: Take on only as much as you can bear.

Sahih Bukhari, Hadith 6465 (Fuad Abdul Baqi edition), 6021 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by Abdullah ibn Amr (RA), the Messenger (peace be upon him) said,

لَا يَدْخُلُ الْجَنَّةَ مَنَّانٌ وَلَا عَاقٌّ وَلَا مُدْمِنُ خَمْرٍ

One who taunts others for favors, disobeys parents, or is addicted to alcohol will not enter Paradise.

Sunan An-Nasa’i, Hadith 5672 (Abdul Fattah Abu Guddah edition), 5675 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by Abdullah ibn Abbas (RA), he said,

لَعَنَ رَسُولُ اللهِ صلى الله عليه وسلم الْمُتَشَبِّهِينَ مِنَ الرِّجَالِ بِالنِّسَاءِ وَالْمُتَشَبِّهَاتِ مِنَ النِّسَاءِ بِالرِّجَالِ.

The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) cursed men who imitate women and women who imitate men.

Sahih Bukhari, Hadith 5885 (Fuad Abdul Baqi edition), 5465 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by Abdullah ibn Umar (RA), the Messenger (peace be upon him) said,

خَالِفُوا الْمُشْرِكِينَ وَفِّرُوا اللِّحَى وَأَحْفُوا الشَّوَارِبَ ، وَكَانَ ابْنُ عُمَرَ إِذَا حَجَّ ، أَوِ اعْتَمَرَ قَبَضَ عَلَى لِحْيَتِهِ فَمَا فَضَلَ أَخَذَهُ.

Oppose the polytheists: let your beards grow and trim your mustaches. When Ibn Umar performed Hajj or Umrah, he would grasp his beard and trim whatever exceeded a fistful.

Sahih Bukhari, Hadith 5892 (Fuad Abdul Baqi edition), 5472 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Footnote:

Growing a beard is not an optional Sunnah; it is obligatory. Trimming the beard shorter than a fistful or shaving it completely is a sinful act, and this sin is continuous.

Narrated by Aisha (RA), she said, the Prophet (peace be upon him) said,

مَنْ أَحْدَثَ فِي أَمْرِنَا هَذَا مَا لَيْسَ فِيهِ فَهُوَ رَدٌّ.

Whoever introduces into our religion something that does not belong to it, it will be rejected.

Sahih Bukhari, Hadith 2697 (Fuad Abdul Baqi edition), 2517 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Footnote:

Anything added to the religion that is not part of Shariah is considered bid’ah (innovation) and is rejected. No matter how appealing it may seem, such innovations are not permissible to practice, such as holding ceremonies on the fortieth day after someone’s death.

Narrated by Abu Hurayra (RA), he heard the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) say,

مَنْ سَرَّهُ أَنْ يُبْسَطَ لَهُ فِي رِزْقِهِ ، وَأَنْ يُنْسَأَ لَهُ فِي أَثَرِهِ فَلْيَصِلْ رَحِمَهُ.

Whoever wishes for an increase in his sustenance and a long life should maintain ties of kinship.

Sahih Bukhari, Hadith 5985 (Fuad Abdul Baqi edition), 5559 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by Jubair ibn Mut’im (RA), he heard the Prophet (peace be upon him) say,

لاَ يَدْخُلُ الْجَنَّةَ قَاطِعٌ.

One who severs ties of kinship will not enter Paradise.

Sahih Bukhari, Hadith 5984 (Fuad Abdul Baqi edition), 5558 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by Abu Hurayra (RA), he said,

قَبَّلَ رَسُولُ اللهِ صلى الله عليه وسلم الْحَسَنَ بْنَ عَلِيٍّ وَعِنْدَهُ الأَقْرَعُ بْنُ حَابِسٍ التَّمِيمِيُّ جَالِسًا فَقَالَ الأَقْرَعُ إِنَّ لِي عَشَرَةً مِنَ الْوَلَدِ مَا قَبَّلْتُ مِنْهُمْ أَحَدًا فَنَظَرَ إِلَيْهِ رَسُولُ اللهِ صلى الله عليه وسلم ثُمَّ قَالَ مَنْ لاَ يَرْحَمُ لاَ يُرْحَمُ.

The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) kissed Hasan ibn Ali while Aqra’ ibn Habis Al-Tamimi was sitting nearby. Aqra’ said: I have ten children, and I have never kissed any of them. The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) looked at him and said: One who does not show mercy will not receive mercy.

Sahih Bukhari, Hadith 5997 (Fuad Abdul Baqi edition), 5571 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by Aisha (RA), the wife of the Prophet (peace be upon him), she said,

جَاءَتْنِي امْرَأَةٌ مَعَهَا ابْنَتَانِ تَسْأَلُنِي فَلَمْ تَجِدْ عِنْدِي غَيْرَ تَمْرَةٍ وَاحِدَةٍ فَأَعْطَيْتُهَا فَقَسَمَتْهَا بَيْنَ ابْنَتَيْهَا ثُمَّ قَامَتْ فَخَرَجَتْ فَدَخَلَ النَّبِيُّ صلى الله عليه وسلم فَحَدَّثْتُهُ فَقَالَ مَنْ يَلِي مِنْ هَذِهِ الْبَنَاتِ شَيْئًا فَأَحْسَنَ إِلَيْهِنَّ كُنَّ لَهُ سِتْرًا مِنَ النَّارِ.

A woman came to me with her two daughters asking for something. I had nothing but a single date, which I gave her. She divided it between her two daughters and then left. When the Prophet (peace be upon him) came, I told him about it. He said: Whoever is tested with these daughters and treats them well, they will be a shield for him from the Fire.

Sahih Bukhari, Hadith 5995 (Fuad Abdul Baqi edition), 5569 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by Ibn Abbas (RA), he said, the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said,

مَا مِنْ رَجُلٍ تُدْرِكُ لَهُ ابْنَتَانِ ، فَيُحْسِنُ إِلَيْهِمَا مَا صَحِبَتَاهُ ، أَوْ صَحِبَهُمَا ، إِلاَّ أَدْخَلَتَاهُ الْجَنَّةَ.

Whoever has two daughters and treats them well as long as they are with him or he is with them, they will cause him to enter Paradise.

Sunan Ibn Majah 3670

Narrated by Abu Hurayra (RA), the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said,

إِذَا انْتَعَلَ أَحَدُكُمْ فَلْيَبْدَأْ بِالْيُمْنَى وَإِذَا خَلَعَ فَلْيَبْدَأْ بِالشِّمَالِ وَلْيُنْعِلْهُمَا جَمِيعًا أَوْ لِيَخْلَعْهُمَا جَمِيعًا

When one of you puts on shoes, start with the right foot. When taking them off, start with the left foot. Either wear both shoes or remove both shoes.

Sahih Muslim, Hadith 2097 (Fuad Abdul Baqi edition), 5318 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Footnote:

Wearing a shoe on one foot while leaving the other bare is not permissible. Either both feet should be shod, or both should be bare, as per the teaching of this hadith.

Narrated by Jabir ibn Abdullah (RA), he said,

أُتِىَ بِأَبِى قُحَافَةَ يَوْمَ فَتْحِ مَكَّةَ وَرَأْسُهُ وَلِحْيَتُهُ كَالثَّغَامَةِ بَيَاضًا فَقَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ -صلى الله عليه وسلم- « غَيِّرُوا هَذَا بِشَىْءٍ وَاجْتَنِبُوا السَّوَادَ »

On the day of the conquest of Mecca, Abu Quhafa (RA) was brought, and his hair and beard were white like a thaghama (a white plant). The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: Change this with something, but avoid black.

Sahih Muslim, Hadith 2102 (Fuad Abdul Baqi edition), 5331 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Footnote:

If someone’s hair or beard turns gray, they may use dye other than black. Using black dye is sinful. However, if someone’s hair turns gray prematurely due to illness, they may use black dye. Note that most black dyes available in the market are unhealthy and may cause harm.

Narrated by Abu Talha (RA), he heard the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) say,

لاَ تَدْخُلُ الْمَلاَئِكَةُ بَيْتًا فِيهِ كَلْبٌ ، وَلاَ صُورَةُ تَمَاثِيلَ.

Angels do not enter a house in which there is a dog or a picture of a living being.

Sahih Bukhari, Hadith 3225 (Fuad Abdul Baqi edition), 2998 Islamic Foundation Bangladesh

Narrated by Abu Hurayra (RA), he said,

نَهَى رَسُولُ اللَّهِ -صلى الله عليه وسلم- عَنِ الضَّرْبِ فِى الْوَجْهِ وَعَنِ الْوَسْمِ فِى الْوَجْهِ

The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) forbade striking the face or branding the face of any creature.

Sahih Muslim, Hadith 2116 (Fuad Abdul Baqi edition), 5368 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by Abu Sa’id Khudri (RA), he said, the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said,

« إِيَّاكُمْ وَالْجُلُوسَ فِى الطُّرُقَاتِ ». قَالُوا يَا رَسُولَ اللَّهِ مَا لَنَا بُدٌّ مِنْ مَجَالِسِنَا نَتَحَدَّثُ فِيهَا. قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ -صلى الله عليه وسلم- « فَإِذَا أَبَيْتُمْ إِلاَّ الْمَجْلِسَ فَأَعْطُوا الطَّرِيقَ حَقَّهُ ». قَالُوا وَمَا حَقُّهُ قَالَ « غَضُّ الْبَصَرِ وَكَفُّ الأَذَى وَرَدُّ السَّلاَمِ وَالأَمْرُ بِالْمَعْرُوفِ وَالنَّهْىُ عَنِ الْمُنْكَرِ »

Avoid sitting on the roads. They said: O Messenger of Allah, we have no choice but to sit there for our gatherings and conversations. The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: If you must sit there, then give the road its rights. They asked: What are its rights? He replied: Lowering the gaze, refraining from causing harm, returning greetings, enjoining good, and forbidding evil.

Sahih Muslim, Hadith 2121 (Fuad Abdul Baqi edition), 5380 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by Ibn Umar (RA),

عَنِ النَّبِيِّ صَلَّى الله عَليْهِ وسَلَّمَ ، أَنَّهُ لَعَنَ الْوَاصِلَةَ ، وَالْمُسْتَوْصِلَةَ ، وَالْوَاشِمَةَ ، وَالْمُسْتَوْشِمَةَ.

The Prophet (peace be upon him) cursed women who attach artificial hair, those who have it attached, those who tattoo, and those who have tattoos done.

Sunan Ibn Majah 1987 Islamic Foundation Bangladesh

Narrated by Abu Hurayra (RA), the Prophet (peace be upon him) said,

إِذَا أَتَى أَحَدَكُمْ خَادِمُهُ بِطَعَامِهِ فَإِنْ لَمْ يُجْلِسْهُ مَعَهُ فَلْيُنَاوِلْهُ لُقْمَةً ، أَوْ لُقْمَتَيْنِ ، أَوْ أُكْلَةً ، أَوْ أُكْلَتَيْنِ فَإِنَّهُ وَلِيَ عِلاَجَهُ.

When your servant brings you food, if you do not invite him to eat with you, give him one or two morsels of food, for he has endured its heat and effort.

Sahih Bukhari, Hadith 2557 (Fuad Abdul Baqi edition), 5065 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by Abu Hurayra (RA), the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said,

طَعَامُ الاِثْنَيْنِ كَافِي الثَّلاَثَةِ وَطَعَامُ الثَّلاَثَةِ كَافِي الأَرْبَعَةِ.

The food of two is sufficient for three, and the food of three is sufficient for four.

Sahih Bukhari, Hadith 5392 (Fuad Abdul Baqi edition), 5000 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by Nafi’ (RA),

كَانَ ابْنُ عُمَرَ لاَ يَأْكُلُ حَتَّى يُؤْتَى بِمِسْكِينٍ يَأْكُلُ مَعَهُ فَأَدْخَلْتُ رَجُلاً يَأْكُلُ مَعَهُ فَأَكَلَ كَثِيرًا فَقَالَ يَا نَافِعُ لاَ تُدْخِلْ هَذَا عَلَيَّ سَمِعْتُ النَّبِيَّ صلى الله عليه وسلم يَقُولُ الْمُؤْمِنُ يَأْكُلُ فِي مِعًى وَاحِدٍ وَالْكَافِرُ يَأْكُلُ فِي سَبْعَةِ أَمْعَاءٍ.

Ibn Umar (RA) would not eat until a poor person was brought to eat with him. One day, I brought a man to eat with him, and he ate a lot. Ibn Umar said: O Nafi’! Do not bring such a person to me again. I heard the Prophet (peace be upon him) say: A believer eats with one stomach, while a disbeliever eats with seven.

Sahih Bukhari, Hadith 5393 (Fuad Abdul Baqi edition), 5001 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by Abu Juhaifa (RA), the Prophet (peace be upon him) said,

لاَ آكُلُ مُتَّكِئًا.

I do not eat while reclining.

Sahih Bukhari, Hadith 5398 (Fuad Abdul Baqi edition), 5006 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Footnote:

It is Sunnah not to recline while eating. For a healthy person capable of sitting upright, reclining or leaning while eating or drinking is discouraged. In another hadith, narrated by Abdullah ibn Amr (RA), it is stated that the Prophet (peace be upon him) was never seen eating while reclining in a normal state. (Sunan Abu Dawood 4/287) Another hadith states that the Prophet (peace be upon him) said: I am a servant of Allah; I eat as a servant eats and sit as a servant sits. (Kitabuz Zuhd, p. 11) However, there is leeway for those who are ill or weak to eat while reclining, as it is proven that the Prophet (peace be upon him) ate while reclining due to weakness caused by hunger, as narrated by Anas (RA): I saw the Prophet (peace be upon him) eating dates while reclining due to hunger and weakness. Source: https://www.alkawsar.com/bn/qa/answers/detail/1168

Narrated by Aisha (RA),

كَانَ النَّبِيُّ صلى الله عليه وسلم يُحِبُّ التَّيَمُّنَ مَا اسْتَطَاعَ فِي طُهُورِهِ وَتَنَعُّلِهِ وَتَرَجُّلِهِ ،

The Prophet (peace be upon him) preferred to use his right side as much as possible in purification, putting on shoes, and combing his hair.

Sahih Bukhari, Hadith 5380 (Fuad Abdul Baqi edition), 4988 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by Umar ibn Abu Salama (RA),

كُنْتُ غُلاَمًا فِي حَجْرِ رَسُولِ اللهِ صلى الله عليه وسلم وَكَانَتْ يَدِي تَطِيشُ فِي الصَّحْفَةِ فَقَال لِي رَسُولُ اللهِ صلى الله عليه وسلم يَا غُلاَمُ سَمِّ اللَّهَ وَكُلْ بِيَمِينِكَ وَكُلْ مِمَّا يَلِيكَ فَمَا زَالَتْ تِلْكَ طِعْمَتِي بَعْدُ.

As a young boy under the care of the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him), my hand used to wander around the dish. The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said to me: O boy! Say Bismillah, eat with your right hand, and eat from what is near you. From then on, that became my way of eating.

Sahih Bukhari, Hadith 5376 (Fuad Abdul Baqi edition), 4984 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)
